column2: Word is going around that since the epidemic came to [capital.GetName] we have seen an increase in cats. Our people are sure the cats are helping the spread of disease.

[cat_examiner.GetFirstName] reports that apart from showing disapproval of their capture, most of the cats seemed calm and healthy. Only a few show symptoms of illness, it is unlikely that cats are the cause.
Complaints about the cats will not end, an angry mob has gathered claiming that cats are the bringers of bad luck and cannot be allowed to roam the streets.

[worried_courtier.GetFirstName] has gotten the news of my decision to remove all the cats. 'Surely cats that are perfectly healthy should not be harmed, I could not accept that!' [worried_courtier.GetSheHe] says.
[worried_courtier.GetFirstName] should have taken care of hiding [worried_courtier.GetHerHis] feline friends. They have been spotted by others and now the people are furious this was kept secret.
One of the examined cats seems to have taken a liking to you, a sweet meow whenever you pass by their cages and a soft purr whenever you come close.
[From.GetTitledName] has called for all cats to be terminated, as you enjoy your time with the cats around the court, this would be horribly upsetting.
[From.GetTitledName] refused to make an exception.
[From.GetTitledName] agreed to let me keep the cats, in exchange for a favor.
After months of chatter about cats it appears as if the common people are now focusing on other things.
Dissatisfied with my actions in the matter, the peasants have come with demands of not only the removal of all cats, but also additional tax refunds as compensation for me neglecting them earlier.

My court [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] informs that there is unrest within my borders. The recent outbreak of disease has made people worry that it is the wrath of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. Some are even saying that it's my fault, for not going to temple more often.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I recite the mantras of Shiva's enlightenment. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with my patron god, the fair Shiva.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I recite the holy words of Vishnu. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with my patron god, Vishnu, the Protector.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I focus my emotions on Brahma, the creator. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with my patron god, the mighty Brahma.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I recite the chant of Kali. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with my patron god, Kali, the Goddess of Time.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I recite the mantras of Ganesha. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with my patron god, the wise Ganesha.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I recite the mantras. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with my patron god, the holy Ganga.

I place the holy basil on the steps of the temple. I light the diya and I recite the mantra of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. My subjects have noticed the regularity with which I see to the rituals, but most importantly I feel reconnected with the gods.

My agent's regular visits to the temple has placated the commoners. I sometimes wonder what [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] thinks of me for deceiving my people this way, but my council agrees - it would do no one good if the [Root.GetTitle] fell ill.

In the face of the misery tormenting our lands, the people of [Root.Capital.GetName] have found a new faith in me, their pious [Root.GetTitle]. One family has even sent their only child to be my servant, would I wish it - in their eyes they would be serving [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
The commoners have discovered my ruse! They have murdered my double and set fire to the temple! They now think that I, as well as the gods, have abandoned them.
The doubles I hired don't really look like me, but most of the peasants have never even seen my face - it's no wonder they believed that ugly impostor to be their real [Root.GetTitle].

The speech I gave about the gods demanding everyone's labor put a decent amount of fear into the commoners - they are working around the clock, the recent epidemic fueling a race against time. However, some rebels have been sabotaging the construction, and the suspects have been brought before me.
The temple is finished and the people wipe the sweat from their brow. [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap] will not be able to take this token of worship from me. The gods are certainly pleased.

Construction was already going on at the location I had planned to set up my temple! The builders saw easy money in my orders and "forgot" to inform me. Thankfully, my [Root.GetTreasurerName] has sorted it out. At least I get a small refund.

[vagrant_child_1.GetBestName] has been caught sneaking into the stable. [vagrant_child_1.GetHerHisCap] sibling claims they are friends with one of the elephants there, but some ruckus upset the animal and [vagrant_child_1.GetBestName] has been injured. The workers have put down their tools, declaring the project cursed!

Chaos has erupted in the stable nearby the construction site and elephants are going rampage! Some workers have been killed, and the survivors refuse to go back. They are saying that the project is cursed!

Your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [From.GetFirstName] has brought you some troubling news. Words are spreading that worshipers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] are the root of the terrible epidemic ravaging your realm. [From.GetTitledFirstName] encourages you to look into these rumors.

[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has brought you an alarming amount of people who claim to have witnessed the abomination of witchcraft. If you are to believe their accounts, the allies of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] are many and pose a great threat to your realm.

[bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName] has brought you some distressing news - [bg_witch_finder.GetSheHe] is certain that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is a [bg_likely_witch.GetWarlockWitch]! [bg_witch_finder.GetSheHeCap] claims to have seen [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] talking to [bg_likely_witch.GetHerselfHimself] in a strange tongue and also informs you of several incidents where [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] has assaulted other members of court.

After a thorough investigation, [bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName] has come to the conclusion that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is most likely the [bg_likely_witch.GetWarlockWitch] in your court. [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHeCap] has been seen talking to themselves in strange languages and a few poor souls have even been assaulted by [bg_likely_witch.GetHerHim].

[bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName] has told you something quite unsettling. Apparently [bg_witch_finder.GetSheHe] has reason to believe that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is a [bg_likely_witch.GetWarlockWitch]! [bg_witch_finder.GetSheHeCap] claims to have found condemning scriptures in [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName]'s chambers, suggesting that [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] is not a true servant of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

After a thorough investigation, [bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName] has come to the conclusion that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is most likely the [bg_likely_witch.GetWarlockWitch] in your court. [bg_witch_finder.GetFirstName] claims to have found condemning scriptures in [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName]'s chambers, suggesting that [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] is not a true servant of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

[bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName] approaches you with a most serious accusation - [bg_witch_finder.GetSheHe] believes that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is a [bg_likely_witch.GetWarlockWitch]! [bg_witch_finder.GetSheHeCap] says that everyone knows [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] to be a most sinful [bg_likely_witch.GetManWoman] and as such [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] must be consorting with [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName].

After a thorough investigation, [bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName] has come to the conclusion that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is most likely the [bg_likely_witch.GetWarlockWitch] in your court. Everyone knows [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] to be a most sinful [bg_likely_witch.GetManWoman] and as such [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] must be consorting with [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName].

[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName] and [bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName] burst into your throne room, yelling madly. Apparently both have reasons to believe that the other is a practitioner of witchcraft. While the accusations are dire, there is no physical proof. You only have your gut feeling to go on.

Your courtier [bg_jealous_lover.GetTitledFirstName] has told you some quite condemning things about [bg_spouse.GetTitledFirstName]. [bg_jealous_lover.GetSheHeCap] claims that the latter is consorting with [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] and must be stopped for the good of everyone, especially [bg_spouse.GetHerHis] poor [bg_lover.GetHusbandWife] [bg_lover.GetTitledFirstName].
You have taken some time to consider your targets. Whom at court could you accuse of witchcraft and get away with it? Now you finally believe you have some good options. No one should question you...
The judgment day has arrived! It is time to deal with those who have consorted with [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] and threatened your realm. What will you do?

It seems like the precautions you took has paid off. There has been very little talk of witchcraft during the last weeks and no accusations. While you will never know for certain if those prosecuted were to blame for the epidemic, at least everyone else seem relieved...

It has been many months since peasants and courtiers alike began to call for a witch hunt. Despite their best efforts to point fingers you have found no one you believe to be a real follower of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. They have now given up hope of you ever finding the guilty infidels.

Today you found [bg_relative_witch.GetFirstName] stabbed to death in [bg_relative_witch.GetHerHis] chamber. You saw the courtiers whisper when [bg_relative_witch.GetSheHe] passed them in the corridors, but you never did anything about it. Now the hatred and paranoia which you help stir up has taken [bg_relative_witch.GetHerHim] from you.

Today you found [bg_relative_witch.GetFirstName] stabbed to death in [bg_relative_witch.GetHerHis] chamber. You saw the courtiers whisper when [bg_relative_witch.GetSheHe] passed them in the corridors, but you never did anything about it. Your own inability to find a witch has led to someone taking matters into their own hands and [bg_relative_witch.GetFirstName] paid the price.
Gather some cats for examination.
Pay for some outside help to get cats delivered.\n
So the cats are not to blame. Let them go.
Kill the 'source'.
You find the meanest looking cat from the sample and execute it publicly
I'm sorry [worried_courtier.GetFirstName], even your cats.
Curse you [worried_courtier.GetFirstName]!
I will call her 'Whiskers', my new sweetheart.
I will ask for an exception.
[From.GetTitledName] will consider your plea.
That [GetRootFromInsult]!
What a relief.
A just demand.
Horrifying news indeed! Investigate this for me, [From.GetFirstName].

You send your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] to investigate the rumors about warlocks and witches.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasant Unrest'§! for 10 years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+10.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-50.0%§!
[Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName], you must find these sinners, before it is too late!
You send your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] to find any witches or wizards in your court.\n
You must be right, [bg_witch_finder.GetFirstName]! I will have [bg_likely_witch.GetHerHim] imprisoned!

§Y[bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName] must be a [bg_rival_1.GetWarlockWitch]!
§Y[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.\n
I will protect [bg_lover.GetHerHim] from this evil [bg_spouse.GetWarlockWitch]!

§Y[bg_spouse.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
[bg_dislike_1.GetTitledFirstName] is a [bg_dislike_1.GetWarlockWitch]!

§Y[bg_dislike_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
Light the pyres!
§Y'Peasant Unrest'§! will be removed from all of your Demesne.\n\n
I did what I had to do.
I pray it will be over now.
My [bg_relative_witch.GetFirstName]...
[bg_relative_witch.GetTitledFirstName] has been killed by people believing [bg_relative_witch.GetHerHim] to be a [bg_relative_witch.GetWarlockWitch].\n
They're right. I should make more of an effort.
You start attending temple twice a day.\n
I beg the gods are pleased as well.
Let's keep up the charade! Peasants truly are too easy to fool.
Depending on your skills of deception the commoners may or may not end up completely calmed.\n\n
Humble beginnings or not, the child could be a good servant.
A child named §Y[zealous_child.GetBestName]§! appears at your court.\n§Y'Civil Unrest'§! will be removed from all of your Demesne\n
Filthy peasants, how dare they?!

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Furious Peasants'§! for ten years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+25.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-75.0%§!
I love a good ruse.
§Y'Civil Unrest'§! will be removed from all of your Demesne\n
Vandalizing a TEMPLE? Off with their heads!

You execute the street urchins, increasing the morale of your workers.

§Y'Civil Unrest'§! will be removed from all of your Demesne
Some people sure work well under pressure.
§YFurious Peasants§! will be removed from all of your counties.\n
That fool of a child! I should never have taken [vagrant_child_1.GetHerHim] in.

Your attempts to quell the peasant unrest fail.
All of your Demesne gets §Y'Furious Peasants'§! for ten years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+25.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-75.0%§!
No, the cats are not to blame.
Keep some for observation.
Cats are not the cause.
You calm the mob down with a convincing speech
We can keep it a secret. But you owe me.
I will call her 'Mittens', my new sweetheart.
I cannot argue with my liege.
You have no power here!
Warn the court - everyone must stay vigilant!
Make sure that all of your courtiers are watching for signs of witchcraft.\n
These accusations are preposterous! [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s faithful servant!
You dismiss the intelligence §Y[bg_witch_finder.GetTitledFirstName]§! gave you.\n
There is only one [bg_rival_2.GetWarlockWitch] here and that is [bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName]!

§Y[bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
Keep your nose out of others' business!
You dismiss the intelligence §Y[bg_jealous_lover.GetTitledFirstName]§! gave you.\n
Imprison the heretic [bg_dislike_2.GetTitledFirstName]!

§Y[bg_dislike_2.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
Let them rot in the dungeon.
You let the prisoners rot in the dungeon.
I can't risk being infected by the recent disease. Send a double!
You order your [Root.GetSpymasterName] §Y[hindu_spymaster.GetFirstName]§! to hire an actor to attend temple for you twice a day.\n
I should stop this while I can.
You call of the deception.\n\n
I don't worship for fame, nor will I tear a child from their family.
You provide the family with a small gift, recommending they send the youngster to temple studies instead.\n§Y'Civil Unrest'§! will be removed from all of your Demesne\n
I'll have to fire that worthless [Root.GetSpymasterName] of mine!
You blame it all on your [Root.GetSpymasterName]!\n\n
I couldn't have done it without my trusted [Root.GetSpymasterName].
They can have shelter - in prison!
You imprison the vandals.\n\n
This is highly unfortunate!
Your attempt to placate the peasants fail.
Superstitious peasants! What about my investment?
Cats seem mostly healthy.
Try your best to explain the cat situation.
I will call her 'Boots', my new sweetheart.
Nonsense! There are no such things as warlocks and witches!

You dismiss the rumors and the concerns of [Root.GetLordSpiritualName].

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasant Crisis'§! for 10 years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+15.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-75.0%§!
Actually, I already have my suspicions...
Take the opportunity and denounce someone you dislike as a practitioner of witchcraft.\n
I'm no fool! Both of you worship [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!

§Y[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! and §Y[bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
[bg_dislike_3.GetTitledFirstName] is to blame for the affliction!

§Y[bg_dislike_3.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
Teach them about [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s great mercy.
I shall build a temple for the restless souls.
You order the construction of a temple nearby [Root.Capital.GetName].\n
These are the villains? But they are children!

You take pity on the vagrant youths. Two youngsters named §Y[vagrant_child_1.GetBestName]§! and §Y[vagrant_child_2.GetBestName]§! join your court.

All of your Demesne gets §Y'Furious Peasants'§! for ten years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+25.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-75.0%§!
Get rid of all cats!
The people would not approve.
These stories are ridiculous. Stop wasting my time!
You dismiss the witnesses and the concerns of [Root.GetLordSpiritualName].\n
This is absurd! Get out of my sight!
You dismiss §Y[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! and §Y[bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
I will be merciful and accuse no one.
I am [Root.GetTitle]! I do as I please.
You allow the unrest to continue.
This is absurd, go home.
Something must be done!
...but I don't really care
The peasants in my realm are becoming convinced that Jews are behind the recent epidemic. I'm under increasing pressure from some to condemn the Jews, and from others to protect them.
Only followers of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodNameCap] could believe that!
The Jews did cause it, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] has told me!

There is unrest in the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the peasants are up in arms over the possibility that the Jews caused the recent epidemic there. If left unchecked they may take matters into their own hands and start killing them.
No, the Jews are not to blame.
The Jews did this, expel them!
[Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] has made it clear he does not want the Jews to be blamed for these diseases, but not everyone is listening to him. I still need to decide what to do.
Although [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] has joined the condemnation of the Jews, I am still not sure it is the right thing to do. I am [Root.GetTitle] here after all.
Despite the widespread condemnation of the Jews, I am still not sure they are to blame for the recent epidemic. However, as [Root.GetTitle] I need to make a decision.
Send troops to stop them.
Let them do it.
There are rumors that a pogrom is going to take place in [pogrom_city_target.GetName], despite my decree that the Jews are not to blame for the epidemic.
There are rumors that a pogrom is going to take place in a nearby village, despite my decree that the Jews are not to blame for the epidemic.

To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]. I have heard of the trouble in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] and I must ask that you ensure the safety of the Jews, they are not to blame for the Epidemics.

To [Root.GetTitledFirstName] from [From.GetTitledFirstName]. I have heard of the trouble in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], and I fully agree that the Jews are to blame for your problems. Drive them out or kill them, I care not.
